summary.para: Retrieves a copy of the AC Huffman table for the specified scan and table.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: The zero-based index of the scan for which data is retrieved.

param.name: tableIndex
param.para: The index of the AC Huffman table to retrieve.

param.name: pAcHuffmanTable
param.para: A pointer that receives the table data. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified scan index is invalid.
Can occur if pAcHuffmanTable is NULL or if tableIndex does not point to a valid table slot. Check the scan header for valid table indices.

summary.para: Retrieves a copy of the DC Huffman table for the specified scan and table.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: The zero-based index of the scan for which data is retrieved.

param.name: tableIndex
param.para: The index of the DC Huffman table to retrieve.

param.name: pDcHuffmanTable
param.para: A pointer that receives the table data. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified scan index is invalid.
Can occur if pTable is NULL or if tableIndex does not point to a valid table slot. Check the scan header for valid table indices.

summary.para: Retrieves a copy of the quantization table.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: The zero-based index of the scan for which data is retrieved.

param.name: tableIndex
param.para: The index of the quantization table to retrieve.

param.name: pQuantizationTable
param.para: A pointer that receives the table data. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified scan index is invalid.
Can occur if pTable is NULL or if tableIndex does not point to a valid table slot. Check the scan header for valid table indices.

summary.para: Writes scan data to a JPEG frame.

param.name: cbScanData
param.para: The size of the data in the pbScanData parameter.

remarks.para: WriteScan may be called multiple times. Each call appends the scan data specified to any previous scan data. Complete the scan by calling .

Any calls to set encoder parameters or image metadata that will appear before the scan data in the resulting JPEG file must be completed before the first call to this method. This includes calls to , , , , and . is required as it has no default value for encoded image size.

summary.para: Exposes methods for writing compressed JPEG scan data directly to the WIC encoder's output stream. Also provides access to the Huffman and quantization tables.

remarks.para: Obtain this interface by calling on the Windows-provided interface for the JPEG encoder.
The WIC JPEG encoder supports a smaller subset of JPEG features than the decoder does.

item.description: The encoder is limited to a single scan. It does not support encoding images that are multi-scan, either for progressive encoding or planar component data.

The encoder supports two quantization tables, two AC Huffman tables, and two DC Huffman tables. The luma tables are used for the Y channel and, in the case of YCCK, the black channel. The chroma tables are used for the CbCr channels.
The encoder supports encoding gray, YCbCr (RGB), and YCCK (CMYK).
The encoder supports 4 fixed component subsampling, 4:2:0, 4:2:2, 4:4:0, and 4:4:4. This subsamples chroma only.
The encoder does not support restart markers.
